parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Present Infinitive Middle or Passive
str2: To journey through (past). From dia and poreuomai; to travel through.
A primary preposition denoting the channel of an act; through.
Sown; neut. plur: sown fields. From sporos; sown, i.e. a planted field.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
A learner, disciple, pupil. From manthano; a learner, i.e. Pupil.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To pluck, pluck off. Perhaps akin to the alternate of haireomai, and thus to suro; to pull off.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A head of grain. From the base of histemi; a head of grain.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To rub, rub to pieces. Prolongation from the same base as psallo; to triturate, i.e. to rub out.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: Strengthened for a primary edo; used only in certain tenses, the rest being supplied by phago; to eat.
